tk.artsakenos.iperlibroid.U_Core

Class U_Service

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • tk.artsakenos.iperlibroid.U_Core.U_Service
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocationService

    public abstract class U_Service
extends android.app.Service
    Requires Permission:

    1) Create a Service from Android Studio 2) Extend U_Service 

      public MyService() {
      super(LauncherActivity.class); } // Il costruttore vuole la classe della Launcher
      [...]
    3) register message handlers (copy the following on the Launcher Activity) Create a receiver, e.g., 
             private final BroadcastReceiver receiverServiceToActivity = new BroadcastReceiver() {
         .Override
         public void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent) {
             Bundle bundle = intent.getExtras();
             if (bundle != null) {
                 String message = bundle.getString(U_Service.MESSAGE);
                 Location location = bundle.getParcelable(U_Service.OBJECT);
                 U_Log.log("MESSAGE from Service to Activity", message + " _ " + location);

                 assert location != null;
                 txtTitle.setText(String.format(Locale.getDefault(), "%3.5f@%3.5f (%s)",
                         location.getLatitude(),
                         location.getLongitude(),
                         location.getProvider()));
                 Delgado delgadoLocation = new Delgado(location.getLatitude(), location.getLongitude(), location.getProvider(),
                         location.getTime(), user, user, false, false);
                 delgadoClient.postDelgado(delgadoLocation, delgadoClient.CB_Default);
             }
         }
     };
    and register / deregister it 
        protected void onResume() {
         super.onResume();
         registerReceiver(receiverServiceToActivity, new IntentFilter(LocationService.NOTIFICATION_S2A));
    [...]
    protected void onPause() {
         super.onPause();
         unregisterReceiver(receiverServiceToActivity);
    4) Launch and Stop the service from the Context as shown below.

    // From the Launcher Activity, e.g., with a Toggle Button ToggleButton btnService = findViewById(R.id.btnService); btnService.setOnCheckedChangeListener(new CompoundButton.OnCheckedChangeListener() { public void onCheckedChanged(CompoundButton buttonView, boolean isChecked) { if (isChecked) { Intent service = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), LocationService.class); service.putExtra("user", user); service.setAction(U_Service.ACTION_START_FOREGROUND_SERVICE); // If in foreground! getApplicationContext().startService(service); } else { Intent intent = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), LocationService.class); intent.setAction(U_Service.ACTION_STOP_FOREGROUND_SERVICE); getApplicationContext().startService(intent); } } }); btnService.setChecked(U_Service.isServiceRunning(this, LocationService.class));

    Stop the Service (no foreground) ---------------- If no foreground: From Activity: context.stopService() From the service: stopSelf(); if foreground From the service: stopForegroundService();

    5) Send Message ------------ From the Activity: U_Service.sendMessage_A2S(getApplicationContext(), "Ciao!"); From the Service: sendMessage_S2A(...) 6) Change Notification use .notification(...) method.
